title: IEEE 754 Special Values
body:
by **peter.hans.froehlich**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. The language definition mentions "infinity" once in a rounding context.
2. The word "special" shows up a few times, never in float[32|64] context.
3. Hence it seems that [-]infinity and Nan are not accessible from Go.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
n/a

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
n/a

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
b0524afd0d7c tip

Please provide any additional information below.
OpenAL allows [-]infinity in a few places, so it would be nice to have it.
